questions.question_text:
You want to block access to the website www.eicar.org using a custom IPS signature.

Which custom IPS signature should you configure?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The correct answer is:

D. F-SBID ( --name “eicar”; --protocol tcp; --service HTTP; --flow from_client; --pattern “www.eicar.org”; --no_case; --context host;)
Protocol: TCP

 Since the website (www.eicar.org) uses the HTTP protocol, the custom IPS signature should specify --protocol tcp.

Service: HTTP

 The --service HTTP setting ensures that the signature applies to HTTP traffic.

Flow: from_client

 The traffic flow should be from_client because the client (user device) initiates the request to the website.

Pattern: “www.eicar.org”

 The pattern must match the website name, which is "www.eicar.org". The --no_case parameter ensures that the match is case-insensitive.

Context: host

 The --context host setting specifies that the signature should inspect the Host field in the HTTP request header, which contains the domain name.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
It's not UDP (A or B).
It's not DNS over TCP (C).
Must be "D".

Selected Answer: D
It's not UDP and it's not "from_server", so D.

Selected Answer: D
route-overlap settings and their behavior:

 use-new (default): Disconnects the existing VPN and accepts the new one.
 use-old: Keeps the existing VPN and rejects the new connection.
 allow: Keeps both VPNs and allows traffic balancing between them using ECMP (Equal-Cost Multi-Path).

Answer in context: If the goal is to ensure that only one remote site is connected at a time, the most appropriate configuration would be to use use-new or use-old.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct
Study Guide 7.2 Page 315

Selected Answer: D
agree study guide 315

Selected Answer: D
p315 of Study Guide

choices.D: Set route-overlap to either use-new or use-old.

questions.question_text: Which ADVPN configuration must be configured using a script on FortiManager, when using VPN Manager to manage FortiGate VPN tunnels?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Enabling ADVPN in the IPsec phase 1 settings is a mandatory step when configuring ADVPN, but it must be done using a script when using FortiManager's VPN Manager. This is because the toggle for ADVPN is not directly available in the IPsec phase 1 GUI within VPN Manager.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct
Study Guide 7.2 Page 340

Selected Answer: A
p340 in Study Guide

choices.B: Configure IP addresses on IPsec virtual interfaces

choices.D: By default, FortiGate-B is the primary virtual router.
choices.B: On failover, new primary device uses the same MAC address as the old primary.
choices.C: 10.1.5.254 is the default gateway of the internal network.
choices.A: The VRRP domain uses the physical MAC address of the primary FortiGate.

discussion.content:
BC are correct
Study Guide 7.2 Page 124-125

Selected Answer: BC
agree study guide

Selected Answer: BC
p124 & 125 of Study Guide

Selected Answer: BC
BC is correct

Pag 125 Enterprise Firewall 7.2 study guide.

Selected Answer: CD
CD are correct
Study Guide 7.2 Page 294-295

Selected Answer: CD
p294 & 295 of Study Guide

Selected Answer: CD
CD is correct.

IKEv2 uses a simplified and more efficient exchange process compared to IKEv1. It typically requires only four messages to establish a secure tunnel in its main exchange:
IKE_SA_INIT: The first exchange initializes the IKE Security Association (SA) and performs a Diffie-Hellman exchange to generate shared secret keys.
IKE_AUTH: The second exchange authenticates the parties and establishes the IPsec SA.

IKEv2 supports EAP, which provides a flexible framework for various authentication methods. EAP can be used for user authentication, allowing integration with systems such as RADIUS or other authentication servers, providing a high degree of flexibility in choosing authentication mechanisms.

questions.question_text: Which two statements about IKE version 2 are true? (Choose two.)

choices.D: It supports the extensible authentication protocol (EAP).
choices.C: It exchanges a minimum of four messages to establish a secure tunnel.
